message.content:
Oxalis pes-caprae is a species of flowering plant that belongs to the family Oxalidaceae. 
It is commonly known as Bermuda buttercup or sourgrass. 
This plant has bright yellow flowers with five petals that bloom in the spring. 
The leaves are trifoliate, with heart-shaped leaflets which are smooth and glossy with a waxy texture. 
It has a bulbous corm, which can produce small secondary corms. 
Oxalis pes-caprae is native to South Africa but can be found in various regions around the world, including Australia, California, and Europe. 
It grows in disturbed areas such as lawns, gardens, and roadside verges.
